title: Duplicate error message in evaluation of module.bazel

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone outside the Bazel team could own this

body:
### Description of the bug:


In some cases, errors in a MODULE.bazel file lead to a duplicate error message, with duplicate Starlark stacktrace.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

External Dependency

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


Here's a small repro:

```starlark
# MODULE.bazel

bazel_dep(name = "mydep")
archive_override(
  module_name = "mydep",
  urls = ["invalid"],
)
```

```bash
$ bazel build ...
INFO: Repository mydep~ instantiated at:
  <builtin>: in <toplevel>
Repository rule http_archive defined at:
  /Users/laurent/output_base/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl:397:31: in <toplevel>
ERROR: An error occurred during the fetch of repository 'mydep~':
   Traceback (most recent call last):
	File "/Users/laurent/output_base/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl", line 142, column 45, in _http_archive_impl
		download_info = ctx.download_and_extract(
Error in download_and_extract: java.io.IOException: Bad URL: invalid
ERROR: <builtin>: fetching http_archive rule //:mydep~: Traceback (most recent call last):
	File "/Users/laurent/output_base/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl", line 142, column 45, in _http_archive_impl
		download_info = ctx.download_and_extract(
Error in download_and_extract: java.io.IOException: Bad URL: invalid
ERROR: Error computing the main repository mapping: error during computation of main repo mapping: java.io.IOException: Bad URL: invalid
```

Notice that the Starlark stacktrace appears twice. In this mini example, the stacktrace is still short, but it can be longer in other scenarios.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


_No response_

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 7.1.0

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


I've tested with both bazel 7.1.0 and last_green.

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


_No response_

### Is this a regression? If yes, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced.


_No response_

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

_No response_

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_
